definition: to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]

sentences.english: Our native land is as pretty as a picture.
Last night the scenery was striking and picturesque .
Proceed on to the Merlion Tower for a picturesque view of the Singapore mainland.
sentences.chinese: 前往鱼尾狮高塔观赏美丽如画的新加坡风景。

sentences.english: Stroilling along the red ancient city walls of Leshan, the picturesque city and countryside views came to your eyes.
sentences.chinese: 沿着乐山红色的古城墙而行，半壁如画江山入眼来。

sentences.english: And the grand temple of Mount Qiqu sits in such a picturesque spot.
sentences.chinese: 七曲山大庙就是在这风光如画的地方建立的。

sentences.english: The Mournes are internationally renowned for their picturesque scenery.
sentences.chinese: 莫恩山脉如画的景色在国际上享受盛誉。

sentences.english: See a picturesque presentation of my calligraphy, Dragon traverses the Dharmadhatu.
sentences.chinese: 请看一幅将我手书如画般地呈现表达的龙游法界。

sentences.english: With the coconut trees shadowing that cape-like picture.
sentences.chinese: 椰树影衬住那海角如画。

definition: nothing more beautiful can be imagined (idiom)
scenic lakes and mountain (idiom); beautiful lake and mountain landscape
water and sky merge in one color (idiom)
lucid and elegant/quiet and exquisite/clear and attractive style
bright and beautiful/(of a landscape) gorgeous/(of a color) vibrant
